item.title: 100 Days Of Hacking
item.description: Programming, terminals, networking, and pen testing. There‚Äôs a lot to love in computer hacking. Are you learning to hack? Maybe you‚Äôve started but can‚Äôt keep motivated or you might not know where to start, let‚Äôs fix that! Here‚Äôs 100 days of hacking, a flexible learning path to keep you on track. Are you in? Yes, good, let‚Äôs go! *Disclaimer, this is designed for self-paced learning and uses multiple resources from various creators.

item.title: Crack The Hash TryHackMe Walkthrough
item.description: Let‚Äôs tackle Crack The Hash, another TryHackMe room full of hash-cracking challenges. If you‚Äôd like a video walkthrough, then see the linked video below for a full guide to Crack The Hash. Quickly, what is a hash and hashing in general? ‚ÄúHashing serves the purpose of ensuring integrity, i.e. making it so that if something is changed you can know that it‚Äôs changed. Technically, hashing takes arbitrary input and produce a fixed-length string‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Äî Daniel Miessler, Hashing vs.

item.title: Network Services 2 TryHackMe Part 2 SMTP
item.description: Welcome back. We are going to be doing the restof Network services two. And this is now part two. We‚Äôre going on to SMTP. So we‚Äôre going to be doingtasks five, six and seven. And then we‚Äôll be finishing off8910 eleven in the next video. If you want a written write up,the link will be below. And if you need anythingelse, please reach out. And if you want to like videosubscribe, do all that stuff.

item.title: TryHackMe Network Services 1 Part 2 Telnet
item.description: Welcome to TryHackMe Network Services Walkthrough Part 2, oh yeah! Let‚Äôs learn, then enumerate and exploit a variety of network services and misconfigurations, second up is telnet. Watch this Network Services Walkthrough for TryHackMe‚Äôs room, Part 2 Telnet. Task 5 Understanding Telnet Questions: What is Telnet? application protocol What has slowly replaced Telnet? ssh How would you connect to a Telnet server with the IP 10.10.10.3 on port 23? telnet 10.

item.title: TryHackMe Network Services 1 Part 3 FTP
item.description: Let‚Äôs go, TryHackMe Network Services Walkthrough Part 3, welcome! Step 1 learn, step 2 enumerate, and step 3 exploit‚Ä¶ but what? Well, a variety of network services and misconfigurations of course, this time it‚Äôs FTP. Watch the Network Services Walkthrough for TryHackMe‚Äôs room, Part 3 FTP. Task 8 Understanding FTP Questions: What communications model does FTP use? client-server What‚Äôs the standard FTP port? 21 How many modes of FTP connection are there?

item.title: Hackers Learning Path
item.description: Want to hack computers? But what is hacking and how do people learn it? Here‚Äôs a vetted list of resources to learn computer hacking. Starting out is hard work, so that‚Äôs why I‚Äôve put this list together, to help demystify hacking for you. The good news is anyone (including you) can learn to hack, and in even better news, it‚Äôs a lot of fun. All you need is effort and time, most of the resources are completely free.

item.title: TryHackMe Network Services Walkthrough SMB Part 1/3
item.description: Task 1 Get Connected Questions Ready? Let‚Äôs get going! ‚Äì No answer needed, carry on. Offline checklist to track your learning path, become a great hacker and stay on task. Task 2 Understanding SMB What does SMB stand for? ‚Äì Server Message Block What type of protocol is SMB? ‚Äì response-request What do clients connect to servers using? ‚Äì TCP/IP What systems does Samba run on? ‚Äì Unix Task 3 Enumerating SMB Run nmap scan.

item.title: TryHackMe Nmap Room Notes
item.description: Are you going through TryHackMe‚Äôs Nmap Room? Did you forget to take notes? I got you covered. Here are my Nmap room notes from TryHackMe, use them as much as you need! Disclaimer, this is written in shorthand format, meaning, full sentences and proper grammar are always not used. For a full writeup, see TryHackMe Nmap Walkthrough, for help with Linux, see Quick Start Guide. Task 1 Deploy & Task 2 Introduction Ports: allow multiple network services, ensure correct device communication, 65535 total.

item.title: Linux Fundamentals 2 - TryHackMe Walkthrough
item.description: So you‚Äôre learning Linux aye? Welcome aboard! Here‚Äôs the Linux Fundamentals 2 Walkthrough from TryHackMe. Let‚Äôs take a look at some of the fundamentals of Linux including some more commands, ssh, bash scripting and more. There‚Äôs lots to love in Linux, I hope you learn something here on your Linux journey! Enjoy TryHackMe‚Äôs Linux Fundamentals 2. Disclaimer, for more, see Linux Fundamentals 1, Linux Fundamentals 3 and Linux Quick Start Guide.

item.title: Linux Fundamentals 3 TryHackMe Walkthrough
item.description: Welcome to Linux Fundamentals 3 TryHackMe Walkthrough, the finale of the Linux Fundamental rooms on TryHackMe. Let‚Äôs learn some Linux skills and common utilities around automation, package management, and service/application logging. Are you keen? Yeah! Let‚Äôs go on with Linux Fundamentals 3 TryHackMe Walkthrough. Disclaimer, see Linux Fundamentals Part 1 and Linux Fundamentals Part 2 for more. Also, see the video walkthrough too: Task 1 Introduction & Task 2 Deploy Your Linux Machine Alright, you should be a pro with connecting to TryHackMe‚Äôs VPN via OpenVPN and ssh-ing into the TryHackMe user via the provided ip address.

item.title: Starting Out In Cyber Security
item.description: Over the last few years, the term Cyber Security has become more popular. Google trends show it‚Äôs searched now more than ever before in history. It‚Äôs currently Australia‚Äôs top hiring priority. What‚Äôs Cyber Security? And why is it so popular? Let‚Äôs do some research and find out! Disclaimer: I‚Äôm not a Cyber Security expert, I‚Äôm a student of IT and love sharing what I‚Äôm learning or have learnt. What‚Äôs Cyber Security?
